loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Ellen.  She is married and has one child aged 28. She has two additional dependents, who live with her as sales assistants.  In 1997, Ellen established her drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in their family affairs. Her business is located on the outskirts of the town and her main customers are men and women. 

Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Ellen requires a loan in order to plough into her business. She hopes that this loan will support her  through its proper use. In the future, Ellen plans to erect a guest house for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old James. He is married and has three children, aged 21, 19, and 12 years old. He has two additional dependents who live with him just for assistance.  

In 2005, James established his clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to take care of his family. His business is located on the outskirts and his main customers are young and old men and women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

James would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more clothing for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him through proper use. In the future, James plans to build more houses and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Osman.  He is married and has two children aged 10 and 3. In 1992, Osman established his commercial palm oil and 'gari' etc. business. He began his business because he had to take care of his family. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. 

Osman would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osman requires a loan in order to buy more stock to improve his business. He hopes that this loan will support him though its proper use. In the future, Osman plans to continue his project. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and bags of 'gari' (cassava grits).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is 20 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a small poultry farm, for raising and selling chickens, since 2010. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan, in order to buy a feather-plucking machine. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income, to build for his future.

loans.use: to buy a feather-plucking machine

loans.name: Kabati Fsa

texts.en:
Kabati FSA (Financial and Savings Association) is a village bank dedicated to improving the lives of its community members.

Most of the FSA’s members live on less than $1 a day, have little collateral, and are therefore unable to access loans through traditional banking services. Its members are mainly farmers and those working in the informal sector, such as shopkeepers, market vendors, and tailors. Most of the FSA members live in a rural setting and cook using open fires and inefficient mud stoves. These produce health-damaging smoke and contribute to the deforestation that is destroying Kenya’s environment. Paradigm’s cookstoves will reduce the toxic smoke by 70% and will reduce the fuel needed to cook by up to 50%. 

Kabati FSA was started in 2004 and has around 4,000 members, 70% of whom are women. The FSA mainly disburses business loans at a very low interest rate. It has a repayment rate of close to 100%. The FSA is fully owned and governed by its members, all of whom have shares in the bank.

Kabati FSA introduced Paradigm’s improved cookstoves to its members in August 2012. The stoves were received extremely well by its members. Most are extremely eager to purchase a cookstove. However, paying for the product upfront presents a challenge. It is difficult for the FSA to raise enough low-interest capital to finance the cookstoves for its members, as business loans make up the majority of the FSA’s loan portfolio. With a loan from Kiva, Kabati FSA will be able to offer cookstoves to its members in four monthly installments. 

With a Kiva loan, Kabati FSA will receive 290 fuel-efficient cookstoves from Paradigm and will offer its members manageable financing terms to purchase a stove. This will make the cookstoves accessible to even the lowest income members of the FSA.  

Help improve the health and financial stability of a rural family in Kenya today!

loans.use: to purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old, married guy, living in Gaza. He asked Ryada for this Start-up Loan, in order to open his own grocery store and shop for selling hot drinks. He hopes that this loan will help him proceed with his new grocery store, and thus, fulfill his ambition of having a big supermarket. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales, and thus, improve his income.

Ryada's Start-up Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period, to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to open his own grocery store and shop for selling hot drinks

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es: Cliceria, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposo  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cliceria is 22-years old.  She lives with her husband, who is her first priority.  With her loan,  Cliceria plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides and to pay for laborers who help with the coffee crop.  In addition, she will purchase some copperwood plants to replant with the rains start.  She wants to have an increased plant density in place to take advantage of the soil's good fertility and the favorable climate conditions.  With these improvements to her fields, Cliceria hopes to earn a bit more and thereby improve her family's quality of life.  She also hopes to invest a little more in her crop and meet some goals.  This is Cliceria's first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't ever taken out loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with coffee farming

loans.name: Fayia

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Fayia.  He is married with one child, who is 11 years old.  In 2006, Fayia established a drink and grocery business.  He began his business in order to take care of his family.  His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are the general community.  Working 7 days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month.  He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.  Fayia requires a loan in order to buy more drinks for resale.  He hopes that, with proper usage, this loan will support him.  In the future, Fayia plans to expand and to open more branches.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly (pictured here with her knitting machine) lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses Mt. Kenya University. She has one child. Her primary income is derived from selling dairy products. She has been doing this work for 17 years. She also runs a tailoring shop within the local markets to supplement her income. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming "keeping cows." Her biggest challenge is "a lack of funds." Her animals are not named. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

Selly was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "because it provides good client training."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She replied, "Juhudi Kilimo is best."

Her highest monthly expenses are her farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Selly replied "It will enable me to generate more income and meet my family's needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Selly owns a cow and a motorcycle but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net and sewing machine but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the fields and then send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 25 years old and from Jericho. He owns a shop for selling used furniture and home appliances, which he has owned since 2003. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan in order to buy more used furniture, for his used furniture and home appliances shop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed, and thus, improve his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more used furniture, for his used furniture and home appliances shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 20 years old and from Gaza. He owns a studio for photography, which he began three years ago, and he has two employees. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan, in order to buy a new professional camera for his studio. Through the support of this loan, he will be able to meet customers' needs, and thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a new professional camera for his studio

loans.name: Audia

texts.en:
Audia is a customer of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited who has been with the institution for some time. She is married and has five children. She and her family live in Lyantonde, Uganda. 

Audia deals in cattle fattening and wants to buy more calves with this loan. In addition to selling cows, she also sells milk. Her major challenge is a lack of working capital. She will be glad to have her loan funded.

loans.use: To buy calves to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Tmam

texts.en: Tmam is a 46-year-old woman from Nablus.  She is married and has 6 children, one of whom is in school.  She owns a small shop for selling and maintaining used shoes since 2002.  She requested a loan in order to buy a new tailoring machine and shoe materials, such as fabric.  She hopes that this loan will help her improve her family's income and help her to achieve her dream of having their own house.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and materials for her shoe business.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila is 28 years old from Gaza.  She is married with 5 children, 3 of whom attend school.  She owns a farm for raising and selling rabbits since 2000.  She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy cages, drinking cans for the rabbits, and an electric generator.  She hopes that this loan will help to increase productivity and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy items for her rabbit business (i.e. cages, drinking cans, generator).

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 32 years old from Nablus.  He is married and has two children, one of whom is in elementary school.  He owns a blacksmith workshop for 6 years and has 10 years’ experience in this field.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a sorting and cutting machine for his blacksmith workshop.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase the productivity of his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a sorting and cutting machine for his blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Anastaz

texts.en:
Anastaz is a 35-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of USD 50 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just USD 0.20. Anastaz started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. 

Anastaz is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 50-year-old woman from Nablus.  She is married with 5 children.  Two of her children attend school and 3 are at the University.  Wafaa opened her grocery store 10 years ago.  She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods, to buy a display refrigerator, and to install some shelves in her shop.  She hopes that this loan will help to increase sales of the displayed goods, thereby improving her family’s income.  This income will help provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods, a display refrigerator, and to install shelves in her shop.

loans.name: Gaudy Patricia

texts.es: Gaudy Patricia, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera,  vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales, además de pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así tener una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia tenga un bienestar mejor y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gaudy Patricia is 18-years old.  She is single and lives with her siblings and parents, who are her first priority.  With her loan, Gaudy Patricia plans to purchase wood and other materials, as well as paying for labor, to make some repairs to her home.  She wants to fix some areas where water comes into the house during the rainy season, which is approaching.  Then her family can have a better quality of life.  With the loan, Gaudy Patricia plans to make some good-quality improvements to her house so her family can have a better sense of well-being and also to take advantage of low prices on some good-quality materials.  This the first loan that Gaudy Patricia has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Claver is a 35-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of USD 50 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just USD 0.20. Claver started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

Claver is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes, to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria, 47 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Managua, es dueña de un pequeño salón de belleza. Ella comenzó a trabajar a los 17 años de edad ya que sus padres murieron cuando ella era muy pequeña por la necesidad de comer y sobrevivir busco un oficio el cual le permitiera conseguir ingresos, comenzó vendiendo ropa y electrodoméstico después tomo un curso de belleza y de ahí inicio con su salón de belleza el cual tiene 18 años de tenerlo, donde además vende ropa y productos de belleza para conseguir otras formas de ingresos. Ella está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar tintes, maquillaje, cremas alisadoras, shampo, acondicionadores, máquinas para afeitar a caballeros, tijeras, peines etc. Uno de sus planes próximos es poner una coctelera   y venta de comida en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She is a single mother with a 3-year-old son. She lives in Managua and owns a small beauty salon. She started to work when she was 17 years old. Her parents died when she was very young and to have something to eat and survive she looked for a profession that would enable her to generate income. She started off by selling clothes, then took a beauty course and then she opened her beauty salon, which she has owned for 18 years. She also sells clothes and beauty products in her salon to generate additional income.
She needs the financing to buy hair dyes, make up, relaxer creams, shampoos, conditioners, razors for men, scissors, combs, etc. 
One of her future goals is to get a drink mixer and sell food from her house.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, make up, relaxer creams, shampoos, conditioners, razors for men, scissors, combs, etc.

loans.name: Caroll Vannesa

texts.es:
Ella es Carol graduada de primaria y secundaria. Tiene 5 hermanos y sus  padres son muy amorosos. Su padre es agricultor y su madre es docente.
Su temporada en el colegio fue muy agradable conoció a gente muy especial; se gradúo de la secundaria recientemente. Sus padres siempre han querido que ella salga adelante por eso decidieron enviarla a la ciudad a vivir con unos tíos, ya que en el lugar donde nació no hay muchas universidades ni muchas opciones laborales.
El primer semestre estuvo tratando de ingresar a las universidades públicas pero no le fue posible, así que, ese semestre no pudo estudiar ya que las universidades privadas son muy caras y sus padres no están en la capacidad de pagársela.
Hasta que por medio de alguien le dio a conocer a la corporación de educación superior, aquí encontró una gran oportunidad de pago y de fácil financiación, se inscribió en el programa de técnico profesional en contabilidad financiera y emperezo en el segundo semestre de ese mismo año con la ayuda de sus padres que con esfuerzos le pagaron sus estudios hasta que cumplió la mayoría de edad.
Desde allí empezó a trabajar y sus padres la apoyaron ya que reconocían que les quedaba difícil seguirle pagando los estudios. Por medio de una amiga ingreso a trabajar en un call center donde actualmente se encuentra trabajando y lleva 8 meses, reconoce que es muy difícil pero uno a veces tiene que hacer sacrificios por lo que quiere; gracias al trabajo que tiene puede pagarse sus estudios y suplir con sus gastos personales. El tiempo que le queda libre es muy poco, pues estudia por la mañana y trabaja en la tarde, pero lo disfruta ya que sabe que algún día obtendrá el fruto de su trabajo.
Se considera una persona emprendedora por eso su visión va más adelante, tiene pensado al terminar su carrera técnica hacer la profesional en contaduría y finanzas. Actualmente esta en el 4° semestre y, ya se siente muy orgullosa de si misma. Por eso se siente muy contenta de que hallan organizaciones como KIVA que quieran apoyar e impulsar el desarrollo de la educación superior en el mundo, sobre todo en su  país de pocas oportunidades, pero llena de mucha gente como ella que quiere salir adelante.
Se encuentra muy agradecida con ustedes y de su parte muchos éxitos en los proyectos que sigan adelantando para el apoyo a los jóvenes estudiantes
texts.en:
Carol is a graduate of primary and secondary school. She has 5 siblings and her parents are very loving. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a teacher. Carol enjoyed school and met a lot of special people there. She graduated from secondary school recently. Her parents have always wanted their daughter to get ahead, and it's for this reason that they sent her to the city to live with relatives, because in the place where she was born there aren't very many universities or options for work. 

In the first semester she was trying to get into public universities but it wasn't possible. She couldn't study that semester because private universities are very expensive and her parents aren't able to pay for them. 

Somebody told Carol about the corporation for higher education, where she found a great opportunity for easily financing her studies. She signed up in the technical professional program for financial accounting and started in the second semester that same year. She did this with the help of her parents, who, with some difficulty, paid for her studies until she reached the age of majority. 

From there, Carol began to work and her parents supported her, since they recognized how difficult it would be for them to continue to pay for her studies. Through a friend, Carol began to work at a call center where she has been working for 8 months. She recognizes that it is very difficult but at times is is necessary to make sacrifices to get what you want. Thanks to her job, Carol can pay for her studies and personal expenses. She has very little free time, because she studies in the morning and works in the evening, but she enjoys it because she knows that some day her hard work will pay off. She considers herself an entrepreneurial person, so she has her future well thought out. She plans to become a professional in accounting and finance when she finishes her degree. 

Carol is currently in her 4th semester and feels very proud of herself. For this reason, she is very happy that there are organizations like Kiva that want to provide support and promote the development of higher education across the world, in particular in her country that has few opportunities but is full of many people like her who want to get ahead in life. She feels very grateful for Kiva's help and for the success that Kiva has in advancing projects that support young students.

loans.use: to finish her studies in financial accounting.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is 32 years old and lives at Tulkarem. He is married and has two children. He owns an Internet shop for Playstation games, which he started in 2010.

Bahaa asked Ryada for this loan, in order to buy some furniture for the Playstation centre. He hopes that this loan will increase the number of his customers, and thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his Playstation centre.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 23 years old and from Gaza. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan, in order to start up his advertising company and buy an electricity generator and a printer. He hopes that this loan will help him to start his dream project, and thus, to improve his income and his financial situation.

Ryada's Start-up Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period, to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start up his advertising company and buy an electricity generator and a printer.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad  de 61 años, está en casado,  vive con su hijo y esposa y la cual  es su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos químicos como también la semilla, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de estas plantas. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar  de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is 61 years old, married, and lives with his son and wife, who are his highest priority.  With his loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and other chemical products, as well as seeds, in addition to paying for labor for the planting and caring for the field.  In this way, he would be assured of doing a good job.

What he hope to do is take advantage of good climatic and soil conditions for this crop, and also put into practice many years of experience in managing these plants.  In addition to being able to buy the best products and of the best quality so that his farm grows well and healthy, in the short term he will have adequate yield.

He will use the income from the harvest that he hopes to get for the wellbeing of his family, to achieve some family goals and to continue investing more in the crops.  

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant ñampi [Costa Rican tuber]

loans.name: Sangmahmad

texts.ru: Сангмахмаду 22 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Сангмахмад очень умный и трудолюбивый человек. После окончания университета он начал работать в республиканской школе интернате преподавателям труда. Он проводит урок очень интересно, и поэтому его ученики очень любят его урок. Сангмахмад работает упорно и честно. Его коллеги очень уважают его. Сангмахмад накопил немного денег, так как он хочет купить машину. У него мало денег и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 1250 долларов США для покупки машины. Он очень нуждается в этой машине, так как имеет маленького малыша. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sangmahmad is 22, married, and has one child. He is a very smart and hardworking person. After graduating from the university, he started working as a shop teacher at a republic boarding school. He ran an interesting class, which his students liked a lot. Sangmahmad works hard and earnestly, and his colleagues think highly of him. He saved some money so he could buy a car. But he doesn't have enough money, and so he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1250 US dollars to buy a car. He really needs this car, for he has a little boy. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy car for his household

loans.name: Felix Fernando

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Felix pudo estudiar una carrera técnica de Electricidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Felix trabaja como empleado en una empresa consultora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, los cuales le servirán de mucho ya que desea cercar un pequeño terreno que ha adquirido, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
Felix, 23, is single and lives in the city of Pisco.  He's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself.  Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Felix managed to study for a technical career as an electrician.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends.  Sometimes he cooks a delicious chicken and rice to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Felix works for a consulting business in his city.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes it's going well for him because of his good performance and friendly treatment of others.

Felix is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy construction materials.  This will be a big help to him because he wants to enclose a small plot of land he has acquired.  This way he'll continue working and making the effort to realize his big dream of having a suitable and secure home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
This is Emmanuel's third Kiva loan. He is about to complete the repayment of his first loan, of $100.00. He is now seeking a top-up loan of $50, which he will use to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights. He will resell the lights, to people who live without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him, to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.

Emmanuel started selling lights in January, 2013, and he has sold 30 lights to date, all financed by Kiva lenders. These 30 lights are providing clean energy to 150 people. This loan will enable him reach an additional 50 people. Emmanuel is also a farmer, and he will reinvest part of the money he makes into expanding his other business. He will use another part to pay school fees for his children as they resume school, in the month of May, 2013.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost, LED lights, which he will resell to rural households that are without electricity.

loans.name: Karoly Vanessa

texts.es: Karoly Vanessa, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltera, vive con sus hermanos y padres  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de  semilla para mejorar la sombra del café hacer trabajos de conservación de suelos y almácigo de una variedad que dé un buen rendimiento, además pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café,  y así hacer  una resiembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Karoly Vanessa is 21-years old, single and lives with her siblings and parents, who are her first priority.  With the loan, Karoly Vanessa plans to purchase seeds to improve the shade for her coffee plants and to do do some soil conservation.  She will also purchase a variety of copperwood that gives a good yield and pay laborers who help with the coffee crops. In addition, she wants to replant at the beginning of the rainy reason with the goal of increasing the plant density and taking advantage of both the good soil fertility and climate conditions that are favorable for coffee plants.  With these improvements to her crops, Karoly Vanessa hopes to earn a bit more and thereby improve her family's quality of life.  She also hopes to invest a bit in her crops and meet some goals.  This is the first loan that Karoly Vanessa has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with coffee farming.

loans.name: Nirmeen

texts.en:
Nirmeen is 35 years old and from Gaza. She asked Ryada for this Start-up loan in order to start her own business, a beauty salon, and to buy an electricity generator and do some decorating for the salon. She hopes that this loan will improve her income and help her achieve her dream of having her own house.

Ryada's Start-up Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period, to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start her own business, a beauty salon, and to buy an electricity generator and do some decorating for the salon

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 28-year-old, married man. He has one child and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and their accessories. He offers to sell mobile phones with affordable and competitive prices, and he provides all the needed mobile phone accessories for his customers. He established his business in 2012, with capital provided by his dad. He is gradually gaining experience through his business, and he is gaining a good reputation in the neighborhood.

He is requesting a Youth Loan of 500,000 YER. He will use the loan to buy phones and their accessories, which will increase his mobile phone inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his revenues, so that he may provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and their accessories, which will increase his inventory of phones and accessories available for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers and soft drinks. She is making good money from sales, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Jacinta lives in a town nearby the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-year-old single mother of three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Three years ago she decided to start a retail shop in order to provide basics for her children. The high cost of rent and price fluctuations pose challenges to her business. Jane's business dream is to trade goods on a wholesale basis. She intends to use the loan to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 52 years old and is engaged in selling snacks in a school canteen. She has been doing this for almost 14 years and earning PHP 200 every day which is not enough to cover their necessities. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy junk food, soft drinks, bread, biscuits, candies and chocolates. She hopes these inputs will lead to growing her income. In the end, she is giving her best to produce a better income and living.

loans.use: to buy junk food, soft drinks, bread, biscuits, candies and chocolates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old, is married, and has 5 children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and is married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marites has previously borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 62 years old and single.

Denia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Denia has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Denia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 42 years old, is married, and has 3 children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items such as soft drinks, detergent, soap, and other groceries.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, detergent, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 26,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., in order to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries to sell at her store.

Melinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Melinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es: Esta es la historia de Manuel, el es estudiante de Campoalto ingresa a su tercer semestre el desea continuar su programa ya que le gusta mucho ayudar a las personas y tiene vocación para realizarlo, por muchas circunstancias no pudo ingresar a una institución de educación superior pero sabe que en Campoalto puede ser un auxiliar de enfermería ubicarse laboralmente y luego continuar con su carrera de medicina, el esta muy motivado a estudiar y necesita financiar su semestre en este momento.
texts.en: Manuel is a Campoalto student who is beginning his third semester. He hopes to continue his degree because he really enjoys helping others and has a calling to do so. Due to several circumstances, he could not enter a superior educational institution but he knows that with Campoalto he can become a nursing assistant and receive a job placement. He will then continue his medical studies. He is very motivated to study and needs to finance his semester at this moment.

loans.use: to finish his studies as a nursing assistant.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a married man and has four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Albert is a farmer. He ventured into this business in order to supplement his meager salary as a teacher. He will use the loan to expand his house and plant and weed his garden. His main customers are nearby secondary schools that purchase the agricultural produce directly from him.

loans.use: to expand his house and plant and weed his garden.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban nació en la comunidad de Sayllapata pero vive en la comunidad de Mika. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 43 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene cinco hijos. 

Esteban es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Esteban was born in the community of Sayllapata, but now lives in the community of Mika. The community of Mika is located in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

Esteban is 43 years old, married, and has five children. He is an enterprising and hardworking father who works as a farmer and rancher. He has several plots of land on which he grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca, and other crops.

A group of neighbors invited him to participate in the “Intipakareq” Communal Bank because he is a responsible and cheerful person. Esteban is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and seeds. He thanks everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: Primitiva nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos y la encontramos en el negocio de lunes a domingos de 5 am hasta las 10pm o hasta que se termine el pan. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.  Su sueño es abrir una cadena de tiendas
texts.en:
Primitiva was born in the District of Challambamba and still lives there.  The District of Challambamba is located in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Primitiva is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Chanca”. Known as a responsible and enterprising person, Primitiva has a business of selling food products.  She has a store in her home where she offers her products.  Her business is open Monday through Sunday from 5:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. or until she is finished earning her keep.  

Primitiva is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.  She is grateful to everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with her payments.  Her dream is to open a chain of stores.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo has been a hog raiser for more than 15 years. He is currently raising two sows, one boar, and three fattening pigs. He also runs a backyard vegetable and corn farming business. He is thankful because he is able to sustain his family's needs and supply his farming business through the income he earns.

Romulo is 58 years old, married, and blessed with three children. One of his children is married, while the other two are single and are his companions in cultivating his farmland. Romulo wants to have continuous growth of his livestock business for him to earn more income. For his dreams to become a reality, he is asking for additional capital of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to allow him to buy hog feed, vitamins for his hogs, and vegetable seeds for his backyard garden business. He believes that this loan amount will enable him to fulfill his dreams in life and with his businesses. Romulo hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins for his hogs, and vegetable seeds for his backyard garden business

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. 

Milton es un padre responsable que saca adelante a su familia pues él trabaja  en una entidad pública y también se dedica a la venta de un plato especial (Pollos a la Brasa). Ya son tres años que tiene negocio de comida y le va muy bien pero siempre necesita capital para comprar mercadería o insumos  entonces una vecina le invitó a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” donde le prestaría dinero para comprar más insumos hoy en día él requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos y papas.  Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Milton was born in the district of Challabamba and lives in the district he was born in. (The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo in the region of Cusco, Peru). He is 45 years old and is married; his beautiful relationship to his wife has led them to have three children. Milton is a responsible father who tries to help his family get ahead; he works for a company. In addition, he has a small business that sells a special dish, Roasted Chicken. He has been in this food business for three years now and the business is doing very well; however, he always needs funds in order to purchase supplies. A neighbor invited him to be part of the community bank "Virgen de Chanca" where he would be lent money to purchase more supplies. Today, he is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies, such as chicken and potatoes. He is grateful to all those who make the loan possible and commits to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a twenty-five-year-old married woman who has two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Jovia sells fish. Her proceeds allow her to pay her children's school fees. In order to increase her income, she has also ventured into selling palm oil, which is a very lucrative business. One of the challenges that affects Jovia's business is the lack of adequate preservation equipment. Her business dream is to own a refrigerated van. Jovia intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en: This time, Maritta is borrowing a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. The rice farming and hog raising businesses that were previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and Kiva continue to provide Maritta and her family with increased income and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Teresita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

NWTF is re-listing Teresita's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de venta de tortillas, ya que los créditos son una fuente de financiamiento para superarse económicamente. Este le permitirá comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, maíz, quesillo, chicharon, entre otros productos. 
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos para aportar a su  familia y para los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan to invest in her tortilla business, because these loans are a source of financing that will allow her to have financial success.  This loan will enable her to purchase a griddle to make pupusas (a traditional dish made with thick corn tortillas), and  corn, cheese, pork, and other products.  

With her last loan, Reina was able to expand her inventory and obtain better earnings to support her family and the household expenses.  Her family's economic situation and financial condition have improved.

loans.use: to buy a griddle, corn, cheese, pork, and other products

loans.name: Gimema

texts.en:
Gimema is married and works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from frozen foods.  

Gimema is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more bags, shoes, t-shirts, and pants for her clothing sales business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, t-shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a hardworking entrepreneur who makes and sells fermented fish in the Philippines. Having repaid her previous loan, she is requesting a new one for PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her fermented fish.

NWTF is re-listing Lucille's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her fermented fish.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
Teresinha, a 33-year-old married mother of three, lives in a village that is far from the city. Married to a farmer, she operates a fishing business she started in 2003 with working capital of $100. The income generated helps her to support her family.

Teresinha is requesting a loan of $600.00 to buy fishing materials to improve her enterprise. She is happy because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) is helping the poor to improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Angie Viviana

texts.es:
Su nombre es  Angie, tiene 19 años , escogio  enfermería porque le parece que es una de las profesiones más valiosas ya que consiste en ayudar a las personas y de aprender del cuidado de sí mismo y de los demás , de desarrollar fortaleza , integridad , respeto y responsabilidad y de formar un carácter de decisión y de siempre poner  tu integridad y la salud de las personas sobre  todo , de obtener conocimientos  de los cuales en un futuro los utilizara para realizar una labor la cual  desempeñara con mucho orgullo y responsabilidad .
También es  una forma de crecer como persona y de poder salir adelante con una profesión que ayuda a sí y  a las demás personas y de brindarle unos aportes a la sociedad, de brindar una ayuda inmediata y oportuna a la comunidad.
Los esfuerzos que ha hecho para estudiar es bastante y a la vez poco ya que en los trabajos que ha conseguido no son  permanentes puesto que  han sido por horas, meses o días. Los que ha conseguido consisten en cuidar niños y en misceláneas, su mama cuando puede le ayuda ya que ella se hace cargo de las cosas del hogar  y cuando ella  puede le ayuda con un aporte mínimo.  Solo viven  ellas dos,   ya que su  papa se fue hace 2 años, la ayuda que él les brinda es mínima. Ya que él se encuentra viviendo  en otro lugar con sus abuelos y les tiene que ayudar.  Espera poder terminar sus estudios  sin que ningún  inconveniente se presente  mientras culmina  en enfermería después  poder realizar las practicas y ya con un poco más de experiencia poder conseguir un trabajo el cual le ayude a aprender más y le de  la facilidad de estudiar y la oportunidad de poder seguir con la  carrera y aprender mas 
También para ayudar a su mama con los gastos del hogar  y que haya la facilidad y la seguridad de que sus gastos no serán muchos y de tener la oportunidad de ahorrar lo del semestre ya que con en algunos casos le queda muy difícil reunir la totalidad de la cuota ya que hay más gastos y como lo ha dicho antes los trabajos que ha conseguido son de un tiempo muy corto y de un  sueldo a veces muy poco , por eso el convenio con KIVA sería una gran ayuda para sí y muchos estudiantes más que quieren culminar su carrera , trabajar  y seguir con ella , espero poder conseguir el convenio por los motivos ya mencionados .
texts.en:
Angie is 19 years old. She chose to study nursing because she thinks it is one of the most valuable professions. It consists of helping people and learning how to care for oneself and for others. It also develops strength, integrity, respect and responsibility. It contributes to form a decisive personality and to put one's integrity and people's health before other considerations. A nursing career also allows one to gain knowledge which the lender will use in the future to develop her profession with pride and responsibility.
Nursing is a way for her to grow as a person and to get ahead in life with a profession that helps her as well as the rest of people. It also brings added value to the society by providing immediate and opportune help for the community.
Angie has made a lot of efforts to study but they are still not enough. The jobs she has held are temporary, for hours, months or days. She has worked as a babysitter, among other things. Her mum helps her whenever she can but she has to take care of the household chores. She also helps Angie with a little money when she can. Angie and her mother live alone since Angie's father left two years ago and he provides very little help. He is living elsewhere with Angie's grandparents and has to help them.
Angie hopes to finish her studies without obstacles. While she continues to study she will do the internship and finally, with a little more experience, she hopes to find a job where she can continue to learn and that allows her to finish her nursing studies and keep learning.
Angie also wants to help her mother with the household expenses, with the tranquility that her own expenses will not be high. She hopes to save enough money for the semester, because sometimes she struggles to save for the full fee due to additional expenses and, like she mentioned, she has only found short-term jobs, often with low pays. This is why Kiva's loan would be very helpful for her and for many other students that want to finish their studies, work and forward their careers. She hopes to get the loan for the above mentioned reasons.

loans.use: to finish her academic program

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina es una mujer joven, dinámica, con 30 años de edad casada que de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales  dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en su juventud sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y decidió no hacerlo y aprender la agricultura misma que fue inculcada por ellos y que hasta hoy en día siguen practicando. Ella tiene mucha experiencia y en compañía de su esposo e hijos elaboran el corte, limpieza, abono a sus cultivos y fertilización. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por ambos ubicado a pocos metros de su casa de habitación lo cual les permite estar siempre pendiente de sus cultivos y evitar que se contaminen con plagas y otros.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de Fertilizantes, Abono y otros insumos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café ya que mediante a esto ella podrá prevenir que su cultivo se contamine y de esa forma podrá aprovechar la producción en su totalidad.

Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean los más productivos de la zona para poder darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, poder educarlos de una mejor manera a nivel universitario para que en el futuro ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida ya que el trabajo de la tierra es pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
Fidelina is a dynamic young woman. She is 30 years of age, married, and has three children who are dependent on her in all aspects. Fidelina never received an education because she did not have the opportunity to study in her youth. Her parents had limited resources, so they decided to teach her farming rather than send her to school. They instilled in her the skills that she continues to use today. Fidelina has plenty of experience and her husband and children help her with pruning, weeding, and fertilizing the crops. She and her husband own the land they cultivate thanks to both of their efforts. Their farmland is located a few meters from their home, which allows them to always be watchful of their crops so that they can prevent infestation of pests and other problems.

Fidelina is currently requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, and other supplies so that she can maintain her coffee crop. This will enable her to protect her crops from infestation so that she can take full advantage of her production. Her dream is to have the most productive crops in the area so that she can provide her children with a better standard of living. She also wants to give her children the best university education so that in the future they will have better opportunities in life since working the land is tiring and the income is minimal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and other farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 58 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community, which he has been doing for over seven years. He earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

Peter is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which he joined in 2008, for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase spare parts and tires for better service. Peter hopes to gain double income from his business. He also hopes that his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en la tienda que posee para así adquirir la mercadería necesaria y brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes; este le permitirá comprar sodas, jugos, galletas, dulces, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y la clientela, las ganancias que recibe las invierte en la alimentación de sus hijos y los demás gastos del hogar; gracias al préstamo otorgado por Kiva puede financiarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefina needs a new loan so she can continue investing in her store and buy merchandise so she can provide better service to her customers.  She will buy sodas, juices, cookies, candies and other things.

The previous loan helped her increase her income and number of customers and she used the income to feed her children and for the other household expenses.  Thanks to this Kiva loan she can pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Ricaurte

texts.en:
Ricaurte is a native of Colombia. He is married and has one child.  Ricaurte has more than 12 years of experience as a beauty supply store manager.  A couple years ago, Ricaurte started planning to have his own business. He started working with LEDC Small Business Department receiving technical assistant to create a business plan, implement his accounting systems, and obtain his licenses. 

Finally this year, he found a good location to start his business in Beltsville, MD. With a  LEDC loan of $10,000 and his own savings, he quit his job and  signed a lease agreement to open his beauty supply store and fulfill his dream to be the owner of his own business. He is hoping to have the same success as in the other stores that he  managed. That will give him the additional income to support his family, buy a new house, and send his child to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his beauty supply company in Beltsville, Maryland.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida, de 39 años de edad , esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Nelida se dedica a la venta de pollos. Continuamente compra la cantidad de aves que necesita para cumplir con el envío hacia los pueblos ribereños en donde tiene clientes que realizan pedidos semanales. En algunas ocasiones envía pollos vivos mientras que en otras oportunidades los envía ya muertos , aderezados y cortadas por presas. Asegura que este trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio .
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de pollos grandes para su negocio .
texts.en:
Nelida, 39, is married and the mother of two children who live with her in her own house.

Nelida makes a living selling chickens.  She always buys the number of birds she needs to make her shipment to the coastal areas where she has customers who make weekly requests.  Sometimes she sends live chickens while other times she sends them already dead, seasoned, and cut into pieces.

She says this job requires a lot of sacrifice because in order to get the good and fresh products she sells to her customers she has to get up early to go to the chicken distribution centers to get ahead of other vendors who compete in this same sector.

She has been in this business for more than four years.  She works alone and says the desire to do things well and generate income for her family are her main motivation to strive for progress.

She's requesting 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] and she's grateful to those who are giving her the loan she needs to continue developing her business.  She'll invest the requested amount in buying large chickens for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old, separated and has four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair her bike so it gives a better service. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her bike so it gives a better service.

loans.name: Roario

texts.en:
Roario is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, eggs and noddles. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, eggs and noddles.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 44 years old, married with two children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He has been in his business for over seven years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair the motorbike so it gives better service. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike so it gives better service.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Martín, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está en casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa y la cual  es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer  una buena preparación del terreno antes que lleguen las lluvias y hacer compra de fertilizantes y otros productos químicos como también la semilla que de un buen rendimiento en esta zona, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y luego la asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de topografía y fertilidad del suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de estas plantas. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar  de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Martín is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his children and his wife, who are his biggest priority. With his loan, he hopes to prepare his land properly before the rains come and buy fertilizers and other chemical products as well as seed that will provide a good yield in this area. He also will pay for labor for the planting and later for help on the plantation, and this way assure himself of doing a good job. What he hopes to do is take advantage of the good topography and fertility of the land that he has for this crop, and also to put in practice several years of experience in the management of these plants. He also wants to buy the best, highest-quality products so that his plantation will be well-developed and healthy and have adequate production in the short term. He hopes to obtain income from the harvest and use it for the wellbeing of his family, to meet some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow ñampí (a root vegetable similar to a sweet potato)

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelica is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Angelica has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelica has been in this business for 10 years. Angelica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Danilo De Jesus

texts.es: Don Danilo  de 35 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres  hijos de 12, 7 y 3 años. Durante 23 años ha trabajado en la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol su cosechas las vende con los comerciantes que están cerca de su zona de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. El está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, semillas, pesticidas y herbicidas, y para darle una mejora a su parcela donde siembra que es la que muestra la fotografía, y así seguir cosechando sin ningún problema para que pueda obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Danilo, 35, is married and has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3.  He has worked in agriculture for 23 years.  His main crop is corn and beans.  He sells his harvests to the merchants near where he lives.  With the profits from his sales he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He's requesting a loan to be able to buy soil amendments, seed, pesticide, and herbicide, and to improve the plot of land he plants, which is shown in the photograph.  This way he can continue growing without any problem so he can earn income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged four. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Ganga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 61 years old and married with five children. Antonina works very hard to provide for them.

Antonina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Antonina has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Antonina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 58 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diosdada has a hog raising business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Diosdada has been in this business for 13 years. Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old, married and has six children. 

Estelita is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and additional livestock to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años cultiva maíz y maicillo, con las ventas que realiza de sus cultivos lleva el alimento diario a su familia puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Vive en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a su familia, por eso solicita un credito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, etc ya que son indispensables para obtener una cosecha abundante y tambien para el mejoramiento de su terreno que muestra en la fotografia, con eso espera poder continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Don Jorge is 49-years old.  He lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  He has made his living in agriculture for the last twenty years.  He grows corn and sorghum.  Don Jorge supports his family with the sales from his crops.  He does not have another source of income.  He and his family live very simply and humbly, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He needs the loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides etc.  These items are essential for obtaining an abundant harvest and also for improving his land, which can be seen in the above photo.  With the loan, don Jorge hopes to be able to continue improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides and to improve his field.

loans.name: Moroni

texts.en:
As many successful business owners do, Moroni developed his latest business – Lalo’s Jumpers – to complement an already successful model. His family had already established several party supply companies, but they complained about the exorbitant costs of renting inflatable bounce houses for their clients.  

When Moroni looked into the cost and overhead of buying inflatable jumpers and operating a jump house rental business, he knew he had a great idea for a profitable business. 

After attending Accion Texas Inc.’s La Idea Business Workshop in Dallas, Moroni was more excited than ever to start his own business. Not only did he have an idea, but he knew he could count on technical assistance and funding from Accion in order to bring that idea to fruition.  

With low overhead and sufficient storage to work from home, Moroni is using Accion funding to purchase inflatable jumpers and equipment. Moroni said he knows that his business will succeed because he knows that the demand for inflatable jumpers for children’s parties is tremendous. 

Moroni is starting his business part-time on the weekends to supplement other income, but soon he hopes to expand into a full-time business. He hopes to use Accion’s technical assistance and workshops to achieve this goal in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase inflatable jumpers and equipment.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene, a 36-year-old married father of three children, two of whom are in school, has a business raising hogs. He is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of feed and vitamins for his hogs.

Eugene is hoping for approval of the loan amount, which will help him earn increased income, enabling him to eventually send his children to higher education and secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 43 years old and has ten children. Ma. Nelia is married and has eight children who are in school.

Ma. Nelia is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Nelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nelia has been in pig-fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is 46 years old and married with six children.

Annaly is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Annaly requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers.

Annaly has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is married and she works hard to support her family.

Ana Marie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 61 years old and widowed with five children.

Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Cristita aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: This time, Cirila is applying for a new loan of PHP 29,500 to buy ingredients for her native foods (bibingka). Her business, which was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide for Cirila and her family, increasing their income and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her native foods.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos.
