Lawrence is a 26-year-old man who is still single. He trades in clothes and works with a company called Tracker Uganda. He needs this money to complete his house. When the house is complete he hopes to get married and start a family. He sells used clothes to university students. He does not have any private means of transport so he finds it challenging to transport the clothes to the university where most of his customers are. He is a very hardworking and humble man. He appreciates the opportunity to get a loan since it will help him achieve his dreams.
The second person in the photograph with a bag is the loan officer

loans.use: to complete construction on his house.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old father and young brother). 

Gorret has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bananas, rice, maize flour, beef, cassava and fresh fish.  She works from a shop and works six days out of every week, but on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.  She resides in  a rented  house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school, transport, clothing and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of green bananas, rice, maize flour, beef  cassava and fresh fish.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino  de 61  años de edad, vive con su esposa, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de él,  vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 11 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras, también vende carne de cerdo.
Don Faustino también se dedica a la construcción, tiene apartamentos de alquiler , sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que transitan por la carretera que lleva hacia el hospital, es una buena zona en donde tiene el negocio.
Don Faustino tiene buena clientela, es bien trabajador y futurista y su deseo es mejorar, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, café, pan , arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, papas, yuca y cebollas con el apoyo de este crédito el espera que sus ingresos y su negocio mejoren un poco, su sueño es construir más cuartos para alquiler.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en: Faustino is 61 years old. He lives with his wife. He does not have any dependent children. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. He has his own home and for 11 years has been selling groceries, soft drinks and vegetables. He also sells pork. Faustino also works in construction. He rents apartments. His customers are his friends, neighbors and passersby on the road that leads towards the hospital. It is a good area where he has his business. Faustino has good customers. He is a good worker and forward looking. His desire is to improve. He is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks, coffee, bread, rice, sugar, lard, beans, cheese, butter, potatoes, yucca and onions. With the support of this loan, he hopes that his income and business improve a little. His dream is to construct more rooms to rent. San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, coffee, bread, rice, sugar, lard, beans, cheese, butter, potatoes, yucca and onions for his business.

loans.name: Ricardo Julian

texts.es:
Ricardo Julián, de 39 años de edad, casado con dos hijos, menores de edad de 12,6 años. Es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Él es un hombre responsable, trabajador con ganas de superación personal, que con mucho esfuerzo pudo sacar su carrera universitaria y en la actualidad está luchando para poner su laboratorio clínico. Para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de laboratorio clínico, desde hace 6 años, ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. El dedica unas 10 horas diarias a su laboratorio, elaborando todo tipo de exámenes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir y comprar materia prima para elaboración de prueba diagnóstica y reactiva triglicéridos, anti A, anti D, creatinina, glucosa, RPR látex. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano. Ricardo Julián agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 39, is married and has two underage children, who are 12 and 6 years old. He is originally from León, which is located in Western Nicaragua. Ricardo is a responsible and hardworking man, who wants to improve and progress. With effort, he received a university degree and is now struggling to start his own clinical laboratory, with the intention to give his children a better future.

Thanks to his hard work and will to succeed, he has worked with laboratory tests for six years in a lab located where he lives. Ricardo works around ten hours every day in his lab, performing all kinds of tests. With this loan, he wants to invest in working capital and stock his lab with the materials needed to perform different tests: reactive and diagnostic triglycerides tests, anti A and anti D tests, creatinine, glucose and RPR latex tests. His goal is to increase his income in the short term.

Ricardo Julián wants to thank Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with fewer resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy materials needed to perform different laboratory tests.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr:
Mr  DAOUDA représente le groupe DIVINE.  Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il n’a personnes en charge. 
Mr  est gérant d’un kiosque depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne à Tampouy. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  01sac de riz, 02cartons de spaghetti  et  un bidon d’huile.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Il  ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr  DAOUDA represents the DIVINE group.  He is single and has no children. Nobody goes to school and he does not have any dependents.

He has run a kiosk for 3 years and buys his supplies in Tampouy. His clients are men and women. 

He would like to buy a bag of rice, two boxes of spaghetti, and a can of oil. 

He would like to save his profits in order to reinvest in his business. He would like to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, two boxes of spaghetti, and a can of oil.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesús

texts.es:
Consuelo de 67 años de edad, es una mujer digna de admiración y respeto.
Es madre soltera de tres hijos, a los cuales educó y sacó adelante. Debido a que su cónyuge la abandonó sin brindarle ningún apoyo económico, esta mujer decidió subemplearse y creó su propio negocio dedicado a  la fabricación de arepas, actividad que realiza diariamente desde su casa y con la cual le ha brindado a su familia alimentación y educación.  
Consuelo hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un motor moledor de maíz, lo que le permitirá reducir los tiempos de producción y aumentar el margen de rentabilidad. 
Sueña con poder constituir su negocio en una gran empresa en donde pueda ofrecerles a otras personas la  oportunidad de acceder al mundo laboral.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 67 years old. She is a dignified woman who is admired and respected. She is the single mother of three children, whom she raised and got ahead. Because her spouse abandoned her with out offering any financial support, this woman decided to work for herself and she created her own business making arepas. She does this activity every day from her home and it has given her family food and education.
 
Today Consuelo is asking for a loan to buy an electric corn grinder. This will allow her to reduce production time and increase her profit margin. She dreams of being able to make her business a great business offering other people employment access.

loans.use: to buy an electric corn grinder.

loans.name: G / S Comerciantes De Mariscos Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Comerciantes de Mariscos está conformado por tres personas, Noemí, Diana, Angelita, Madres solteras con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Son personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Y luchan día a día para brindarles los mejor a sus hijos. Diana es la cordinadora del G.S la que se encarga de la responsabilidad de pago de las integrantes en tiempo y forma.

Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de Mariscos que está  ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. Ellas dedican a  su negocio unas 10 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s Comerciantes de Mariscos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo dignas.
texts.en:
The Comerciantes de Mariscos solidarity group is made up of three people, Noemí, Diana, and Angelita, single mothers with five children in their care.  They're from Managua, located in the center of the country.  They're responsible and hardworking people with a desire for personal self-improvement.  Unfortunately they weren't able to study because they lacked the economic resources.  And they strive every day to give their children the best.

Diana's the coordinator of the group so she's responsible for making timely payments for the group.  Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead she has a business selling shellfish located in some of the town markets.  She devotes about 10 hours a day to her business.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so she can earn better income in the near future.

The Comerciantes de Mariscos solidarity group is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a source of decent work.

loans.use: to buy shellfish

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis de 21 años de edad,  soltero originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades recreativas con grupo de amigos. José Luis es  una persona responsable, trabajadora. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería en sistema.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, azúcar, leche, pan, arroz, frijoles, huevos, detergente. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. José Luis agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José Luis, 21, is single.  He's from León, located in the western part of the country.  In his free time he likes to enjoy recreational activities with a group of friends.  José Luis is a responsible and hardworking person.  Unfortunately he didn't have the money to pursue a university education, but he would like to have studied systems engineering.

Thanks to his spirit and his desire to get ahead, his job is a grocery store ["pulpería"] located in his house.  A pulpería is a small store that sells small quantities of food products such as envelopes of coffee and sugar, milk, bread, rice, beans, eggs, and detergent.  He devotes about 12 hours a day to selling his products.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business so he can earn more income in the near future.

José Luis is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy food to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Akonkwa Group

texts.fr: La cliente rebeka est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Akonkwa, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 48 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants, dont 6 étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propre foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons. Elle étale ses produits à son domicile.  Elle commença cette affaire avec un crédit d'une association locale(tontine) dont elle était membre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit additionnel de Hekima. Il y a 17 ans, que elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 13 casiers de Primus, de Skol, Fanta, Coca, etc. Les pertes, cases de bouteilles, non payement par ses clients constituent un défi pour son activité.  Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Rebeka is the representative of the Akonkwa business group.  She is a 48-year-old widow, the mother of 9 children and an experienced entrepreneur.  Six of her children are in school while some of the others already have their own families.

Rebeka sells drinks.  She displays her merchandise at home.  She started in this business using her own funds, received from a village communal bank.  Later on she benefited from additional credit from Hekima.  She has been involved in this activity for the past 17 years.

Rebeka will use her new loan to buy 13 crates of drinks such as Primus, Skol, Fanta, Coca Cola etc.  Loss of merchandise, broken bottles and non-payment from her customers are the challenges that she faces while conducting her professional activity.

Rebeka would like to increase her capital and educate her children.  In the end, she is very thankful to Hekima for providing support to small entrepreneurs through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy 13 crates of drinks such as Primus, Skol, Fanta, Coca Cola etc.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past five years. With this loan, she wants to add more shoes and ladies handbags for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jesús Albeiro

texts.es:
Jesús Albeiro de 45 años de edad, es mecánico desde hace 30 años, labor que aprendió gracias a su padre quien se dedicó a la misma labor. 
Hoy es padre de dos hijos de nueve y cinco años de edad, y por ellos, lucha diariamente a fin de brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y el acceso a una buena educación. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo ya que la que posee actualmente se encuentra obsoleta y le impide en ocasiones realizar algunas actividades o no generar la calidad en el servicio deseado.
Sueña con comprar una vivienda propia para brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Jesús Albeiro, age 45, has been a mechanic for 30 years.  He learned his trade from his father who was devoted to the same line of work.  

Jesús is now the father of two children, ages nine and five.  For this reason, he strives each day to provide his children with better living conditions and access to a good education.  Today he is requesting a loan in order to buy tools for his work.  The ones he currently owns are obsolete and sometimes impede him with some of his duties.  As a result, he is not able to provide quality service.  

Jesús dreams of buying a house of his own so that he can provide his family a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Mirasel

texts.en:
Mirasel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mirasel is 42 years old and two of her children are in school.

Mirasel has a tailoring business in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to purchase materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

Mirasel has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Mirasel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is noted for producing fish and the Liberia Market. He is 42 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 12 who are in school and live at home. Francis has been running a shop since 2004 where he sells alcoholic drinks likes Godfather dry-gin, White Spirit gin, Black Horse dry gin, etc. He started this business with his father's help and learned this way of selling from him, 

Francis is requesting a loan to buy more alcoholic drinks likes Godfather dry gin, White Spirit gin, Black Horse dry gin, etc for his business. He enjoys how his business makes him popular and he make more profit, especially during the rainy season and the Christmas season. Francis described himself as a very serious man who spends 10 hours, seven days a week on his business. He plans to build a house and he is happy with the lenders who are supportive of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more alcoholic drinks for his business,

loans.name: Maria Iluc

texts.es:
María es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad casada, con muchos sueños y muchas esperanzas. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa cursado hasta el sexto grado y no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres. De su matrimonio tiene dos hijos uno lo tiene estudiando en la escuela y el otro en el kínder. Fueron sus padres a muy temprana edad los que le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura por lo cual junto a su esposo se dedican a trabajar su tierra la cual la obtuvieron por medio de una herencia de parte los padres de su pareja y realizan actividades como: limpieza, poda y fertilización. ella en compañía de su esposo se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 5 años los cuales están ubicados a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie ya que no tienen un medio para transportare hasta él. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono e insumos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.

Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean los más productivos de la región para poder generar mayores ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y con todas las necesidades básicas que a diario se presenta en el hogar y algún día poder comprar un pedazo más de tierra para cultivar variedad de granos básicos.
texts.en:
María is a young married woman who is 24 years of age. She has many hopes and dreams. María finished her primary school education up to the sixth grade, but she was unable to continue because her parents lacked the financial resources. Her marriage has resulted in two children, one of whom is studying at school while the other attends kindergarten. It was her parents who taught her at an early age how to work in the agriculture business. María and her husband work on the land that they obtained as an inheritance from her in-laws. They engage in tasks such as weeding, pruning, and fertilizing. She and her husband have been farming for more than five years. Their land is located three kilometers from their house, so they must travel by foot since they do not have a means of transportation.

María is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy fertilizers, compost, and supplies in order to maintain her coffee crops. Her dream is to have the most productive crops in the region so that she can generate more income to help her children with their studies and to provide them with all of the basic necessities that are required at home each day. María would like to someday buy another piece of land so that she can cultivate a variety of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Shella

texts.en: Shella is 28 years old and a hard working businesswoman who sells dry goods in their community. She has offered dresses and curtains for over a year. She is earning a net income of PHP 300 every day that is used for her business as well as for their necessities.  She wants to add additional goods to sell. For that reason, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pants, shorts and curtains. Hopefully, she will succeed in making a better income.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts and curtains to sell

loans.name: Cesar Luciano

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por sus platillos típicos como la Carapulcra con sopa seca, y también porque sus pobladores son personas muy alegres. Cesar vive al lado de su esposa, la cual lo apoya mucho en todo lo que él hace y juntos tienen un pequeño hijo al cual quiere mucho y todo su esfuerzo y sacrificio es solo  por darle una vida digna.

Cada día Cesar trabaja como ayudante en una mina de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y en  algunos casos trabaja los fines de semana y no puede ver a su esposa, pero Cesar sabe que tiene que hacer algunos sacrificios con tal de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y por ello trabaja con dedicación, el cree que debido a esa dedicación está saliendo adelante y sobre todo  porque tiene una razón por la cual luchar, la cual es su hijo.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar los útiles escolares que faltan a su pequeño hijo, el cual a ingresado a la escuela inicial y también podrá matricular a su esposa, quien aun no ha culminado la secundaria, con lo cual podrá ofrecerle una mejor educación a su familia y seguir luchando en busca de poder tener una mejor calidad de vida e ir tras su gran sueño de la “Casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man who is 21 years of age. He lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its traditional dishes such as “carapulcra con sopa seca” (a spicy Peruvian stew served with dried potatoes). The residents are cheerful people. Cesar lives with his wife who supports him in everything he does. They have a young son who they love dearly. All of Cesar’s efforts and sacrifices are solely focused to providing his son a decent life.

Each day Cesar works as an assistant at a mine in the city. He works approximately nine hours a day. On a few occasions, he works on the weekends without being able to see his wife. Cesar knows that he has to make some sacrifices in order to improve his family’s quality of life, so he works with dedication. He believes that because of this dedication, he has been able to move forward. Cesar also has a reason to keep striving, his son.

He is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, Cesar will be able to buy school supplies that his young son is lacking. His son is starting school and he will also pay tuition for his wife who did not finish high school. By providing the best education for his family, Cesar can continue striving to have a better quality of life and pursue his greatest dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his son and pay for his wife's tuition.

loans.name: Tiego

texts.en:
Tiego is a business management student at the Maharishi Institute. Tiego is 21 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I am studying (for) a Bachelors degree in Business Administration. I enjoy working with numbers, and I am still adapting to business courses as I did not do business in high school. Yoga Asanas and Meditation help me a lot with dealing with stress when coming to multi-tasking.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“After graduation, I want to work in a business organization, maybe the finance part, because I am good at handling finances. I will be very happy if I can work in Limpopo (Polokwane city) or Johannesburg, as they say home is where the heart is. After five years of working, I will then start to invest in properties and build an orphanage home for underprivileged children.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in Gauteng, but moved to Limpopo when I was still young. I am the only child to my parents. My mother passed away seven years back; she was a hawker and she did everything to provide for me and my family. My father does not have a stable job. He does piece jobs like building.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I like to write about my past, present and future. Writing helps me to see how far I have come and see that the sky is the limit for me. I am a dreamer and my dreams always become true. I also enjoy reading motivational books and quotes because they keep me going.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“The Kiva loan will change my life to help me reach my goals, especially the stipend that I will be getting, because I will invest it until I am through with my studies so when I want to start a property business in the future, I will know that I have a start-up plan.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es: Magdalena del Carmen es una mujer de 47 años, madre de tres hijos, originario de un municipio ubicado al sureste de Chinandega, municipio muy productivo ya que en él está uno de los ingenios azucareros más grande del país. Es una microempresaria  se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva para adulto, juvenil y para niños, ropa interior, mochilas, entre otro tipo de artículos que sus clientes le encargan. Magdalena inicio su negocio desde hace varios años, con capital propio el cual logro obtener, a través de los años con mucho esfuerzo, todo con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y ella es el único sostén para sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando duramente para poder tener los ingresos suficientes para poder hacer remodelaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
47-year-old Magdalena del Carmen is the mother of three children and comes from a town in the south-east of Chinandega.  It is a very productive town as it is home to one of the largest sugar refineries in the country.

Magdalena is a micro businesswoman whose business is buying and selling general merchandise such as new clothing for adults, teens and children; underwear; backpacks and other items that her customers order.  Magdalena started her business some years ago with her own capital which she earned through years of hard work.  Her intention is to get her children ahead in life as she is a single mother and the only source of support for her children.  Her biggest dream is to continue working hard so that she can make the income she needs to be able to refurbish her home.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for adults, teens and children; underwear; backpacks and other items

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es: Domingo Leonel, tiene cincuenta y dos años, es padre de un hijo y es originario del departamento de Chinandega ubicado en la zona occidental del país. Inicio hace dieciséis  años su negocio con dinero propio, el cual logro ahorrar con mucho sacrifico desde años atrás, el negocio está ubicado en un pequeño local  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad; en este vende  mercadería variada como ropa para adultos, ropa juvenil y una gran variedad de chinelas, ya que este tipo de calzado es muy solicitado por los habitantes del municipio. Su  meta es invertir más en su negocio para poder obtener más ganancias y en un futuro no muy lejano poder realizar mejoras en su casa ya que los ingresos que tiene de sus ventas no son los suficientes para poder llevarlas a cabo. Domingo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: 52-year-old Domingo Leonel is the father of one child and comes from Chinandega department, in the west of the country.  He started his business 16 years ago with his own money which he worked very hard to save over the years.  His business is located in small premises in one of the city markets.  There he sells a range of merchandise including clothing for adults and children, and a wide variety of flip flops as this type of footwear is very much in demand among people who live in the town.  Domingo's goal is to further invest in his business so that he can earn more profits and, in the not-so-distant future, carry out some home improvements because the income he currently makes from his sales is not enough to do this work.  Domingo is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua as it helps them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy a range of merchandise such as clothing for adults and children and a wide variety of flip flops

loans.name: Claudia Nelly

texts.es:
Claudia Nelly de 32 años de edad,  casada con dos hijos de menores de edad de 13, 1 anos.origianaria del sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país,  en sus ratos libre le gusta compartir con sus hijos tiempo de calidad y comida típica de la región como los “mango en miel “lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería profesional.


Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeña como sobre de café, arroz, shampoo,huevos, tomates, pan, leche, aceite, frijoles, cuajadas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  Y dedica a unas 12 horas diarias al negocio ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería  en la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Claudia Nelly agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
32-year-old Claudia Nelly is married and has two dependent children who are 13 years old and 1 year old.  She comes from El Sauce, in the north of the country.  In her spare time, Claudia Nelly enjoys spending quality time with her children and enjoying typical regional foods such as 'mango en miel'.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial resources, she was unable to study for a degree at university.  She would have liked to have studied nursing.

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead in life, Claudia Nelly runs a 'pulperia' which is located in her home.  A 'pulperia' is a small store which sells food products in small quantities such as sachets of coffee, rice, shampoo, eggs, tomatoes, bread, milk, oil, beans and cuajada.  Claudia Nelly works 12 hours a day in her business, selling her products.  Her aim for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store by purchasing food products so that, in the not-so-distant future she can earn better income.  Claudia Nelly is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua as it provides them with decent sources of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with products such as coffee sachets, rice, shampoo, eggs, tomatoes, bread, milk, oil, beans and cuajada

loans.name: Savon

texts.en: Savon is 52 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for more than two years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a carpenter who makes an income of $3 each day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about $6 per day. In order to improve her house’s security, Savon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house. This money will help her provide high security for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her food store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling palm fruit for more than four years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 each day. Due to a lack of funds, Vann is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband runs the business of cutting a kind of vine to resell. He earns about $11 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokhim is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase a tricycle to use to carry meatballs to sell in the local community. This purchase will help her generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to fix her house with her next loan.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle to use to carry meatballs to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, a 38-year-old widow residing with her three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia, has been selling Khmer noodles for more than seven years, earning approximately $5 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, earning about $7 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Saroeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber and zinc to build a store for selling noodles. This money will help her provide a convenient place for her customers to shop. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to build a store for selling noodles.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom was born in 1990 and she is married.  Thom has been selling clothes for three years to earn a living, and she earns about 4,000,000 VND. 

Her husband is a motorbike repairer. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month, so her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Thom has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy motorbike repairing tools for her husband's store. She wants to spend the profit to enlarge her family’s motorbike repair shop.

loans.use: to buy motorbike repairing tools for her family's motorbike repair store.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 29 years old. She has three children who are ages 7, 6 and 1. She and her husband are carpenters. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Hang’s income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, Hang would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to raise her children up well, enlarge her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Thoan

texts.en:
Thoan was born in 1979; she has three children who are in 3rd, 6th and 9th grades. She and her husband are carpenters; she has been doing this for 12 years. Her husband earns about 6,000,000 VND per month, and her income is about 4,000,000 VND, so her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Thoan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to raise her children well, and enlarge her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Saret is 51 years old. She is widowed and blessed with six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Four of her children are also garment workers. They earn about $14 each day. Due to lack of funds, Saret has asked for a loan of $1500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to build a toilet and a fence around her house. Moreover, she hopes to help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and zinc to build a new house

loans.name: Ile

texts.en:
Ile is a 62-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small business sewing clothes; she has been doing this for five years.  

Ile joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services. She needs a loan to buy more material, thread, needles, and a new sewing machine for her business. 

She will use her profits to help support her grandchildren in school, and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, and material.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes for her thread-making business.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 29 years old. She has three children who are nine, seven, and four.  She and her husband are carpenters; she has done this job for four years. Her husband earns about 5,500,000 VND per month, and her income is about 3,000,000 VND, so her family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. 

Lan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to raise her children well, and enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai is 56 years old. She is married and resides with seven children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband is a deputy of commune leader who makes an income of $2 daily. Three of her children are employed in a factory. They earn about $10 each day. Due to lack of funds, Thai requests a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to build stairs. This money helps her complete her house construction. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build stairs

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Pom asks for a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che is 33 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 per day. In addition, they are involved in rice cultivation. 

In order to improve her farming process, Che is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cattle to use for tilling their farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her farming expenses. In the future, she would like to build a toilet and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling farmland

loans.name: Sautupu

texts.en: Sautupu, a 50-year-old married mother of seven, has a big plantation where she has been growing taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living for more than four years. A member of SBPD since 2009, Sautupu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush  knives, rakes and weed killer. With her profits, she hopes to extend her business to support her family as well as her children's future education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
Silika is 31 years old, married, with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, sugar, salt, rice, canned food ,and freezers. She has been doing this for three years.

Silika needs a loan to refill her stock and improve her house. She hopes to use her profits to extend her shop. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to restock her inventory of sugar, salt, rice, snacks, and canned food, etc

loans.name: Taueu

texts.en:
Taueu is a 62-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a big plantation and she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years.

Taueu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, rakes, and weed killer for growing her crops. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. 

With her profits, Taueu hopes to extend her business to support her family as well as her children's future education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en:
Ilir already has a dairy cow with a baby calf, and at the moment needs a loan to add another one.  

Ilir lives in rural central Albania and is thirty-four years old and married with three children, ranging in age between eleven and two. His main activity for the past fifteen years has been agriculture and livestock, and has also been selling fresh produce to locals. 

Also, in Greece he worked on and off as a landscaper and he very much enjoyed that, but now he plans to stay in his village full time and expand his activity by adding more animals and building a stable.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Iljas

texts.en:
Iljas is a married villager from southern Albania and a father of five children who are attending schools. They live in a region that has been rated 'very poor' through all the past years.
 
The activity that Iljas has been running for the past seven years is livestock. He is requesting a loan at the moment to buy a milk cow. He sells milk to some nearby dairy farms, yet the money he makes from it is barely enough to secure food, let alone afford to buy other things. This is why he wants to add another cow, in hopes of improving their living conditions.

Iljas is very happy that he had the opportunity to be part of the integrated projects.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nooroa

texts.en:
Nooroa is 25 years old and married and has one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

Nooroa needs a loan to buy a box of chicken leg quarters, a box of mutton flaps, sausages, sugar, flour and cooking oil. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's financial needs. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, sausages, sugar, flour, cooking oil.

loans.name: Mushfig

texts.en:
Mushfiq is 44 years old has a family of a son, two daughters and a wife. He sells food products in his shop, which he started four years ago. Currently, he handles the business successfully by himself. With income from sales, he takes care of his children, and also plans to give them a good opportunity for their higher studies. 

Mushfig’s shop is in the central bazaar, where he has a good number of clients daily. Most people require the products he sells, such as sugar, rice, bread, butter, cheese, etc. He has good sales, due to the location of his shop.

He has taken loan from Aqroinvest three times. This time, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN; he wants to provide fruits and vegetables in his shop, which have seasonal demand.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for summer consumption by clients

loans.name: Tuitogamatoe

texts.en:
Tuitogamatoe is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Tuitogamatoe needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Tuitogamatoe will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and support her family and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is responsible for 9 children and strives to support them. At this time he intends to complete building his house by adding a second floor. He started the house with help from his first loan. 

In order to complete the second floor he asked for a loan of 200,000 YER to buy construction supplies. In the future, Ahmed hopes to open a business store to increase his profit. He thanks Kiva for funding his first loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete his second floor.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Kamong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge and Khmer noodle for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophea is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight. This loan will help her acquire the ability to start this new business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Naitua

texts.en:
Naitua is a 68-year-old widowed woman with four children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Naitua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer.

She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Naitua hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a weed sprayer, gloves and fertilizer.

loans.name: Balashah

texts.en:
Balashah is 49 years old and has a family of three children and a wife. He raises sheep and sells them for meat. Balashah considers himself a shepherd. He has been doing this business for 15 years and is a very hard-working person. He gives a lot effort in this activity, because he wants to support his family without financial lacking.

Balashah is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase this. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. 

He has taken loan from Aqroinvest three times and has a good loan history. This is going to be his 4th loan. This time he requires 2000 AZN in order to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep so he can sell more meat

loans.name: Talaitaua

texts.en:
Talaitaua is a 72-year-old married woman with five children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Talaitaua needs a loan to purchase a sack of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks, etc., to help her in operating her business. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her children's education. Talaitaua has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to pay for a sack of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks, etc.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is 30 years old, married, and has a daughter and a son. He raises cattle. He buys calves, fattens them and sells them as meat. Kamran has been doing this business for 10 years now. He says it is a profitable business which requires continuous effort. He wants to become a successful farmer in his town.

Currently he sells the beef in the central bazaar.  Here he supplies the meat to local butchers. In his town people consume a lot of meat, due to their traditional meals. Especially this town is famous for its rich food like kebabs and dolmas.

Kamran had taken four loans from Aqroinvest previously. He is a successful customer. This time he requires 2000 AZN as a loan, because he plans to purchase four calves in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase four calves in order to expand business

loans.name: Ituau

texts.en:
Ituau is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a huge plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Ituau needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009.

Ituau will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and support her family and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 26-year-old married woman with one child.
 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Ruta has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Ruta hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and a weed sprayer.

loans.name: Farqana

texts.en:
Farqana is married, 48 years old, and has 2 sons. She has a shop where she sells various items, such as plates, cups, vases and porcelain items. She has been running this business for 20 years. She gets support from her husband in the shop. Farqana is a good saleswoman, because she has dedicated herself to this business from her youth.

Farqana's shop is in the central bazaar. Here she has customers who purchase these products, according to their tastes. In Azerbaijan families like to decorate their houses with such glass items. Especially newly married couples purchase a variety of these products to furnish their guest rooms.

Farqana has taken four loans from AqroInvest previously. This time she requires 2000 AZN in order to buy the latest sets of glass products like plates, vases, bowls, etc. She wants to expand her business in future and supply neighboring towns with those products.

loans.use: to purchase latest sets of glass dishes, bowls, and vases for her shop

loans.name: Salava

texts.en:
Salava is a 20-year-old single woman with one child. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Salava needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since this year.

Salava will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and support her family and her child's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en:
Muslum is 46 years and has a family consisting of a wife and two sons. He is selling stationery in his shop. He has selling experience from the past 16 years. Previously he used to sell different products in his shop. Now he is focused only on selling items for schoolchildren and students. Muslum is running the business with the support of his wife. He has a shop in the central bazaar. 

Muslum has good sales, due to his location near schools and other educational centers. Soon, in September when schools open, more school items are going to be purchased.

Muslum has taken three loans from AqroInvest previously. Now he requires a loan of 2000 AZN.  With this money he plans to purchase more items for the new semester, when pupils and students return to attend schools and colleges.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery for preparation of new semester sales

loans.name: Somoun

texts.en:
Somoun is 58 years old. He is a widower and blessed with two children, living in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a soldier who makes an income of $4 daily. His children are employed. They earn about $6 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Somoun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to complete building his house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to run an additional business to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete building his house.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 40 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $7 each day.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Ran is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her acquire the ability to start a new business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Emi needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.

Emi will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and support her family and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en:
Aflatun  is 46 years old  and has three daughters. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Aflatun sells food   products in the market. He started his business 15 years ago. His monthly profit is 220 AZN. He would like to earn more profits from his business.

He runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in his town. His customers are mostly his neighbors, who are drawn by the affordable prices he offers.

Now he needs 1800 AZN loan to buy shampoo, soap, powder, butter, tea, rice, and flour, etc. Aflatun  wants to use the money from his new business to help his family and raise his children. In the future, he wants to have a big shop to sell food and detergent products. This will be more profitable for his business.

He hopes to enjoy a better quality of life. This is his second loan and he has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, powder, butter, tea, rice, and flour, etc. for resale

loans.name: Nabi

texts.ru: Наби 31 год. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Рудаки в центральной части Таджикистана. Наби очень целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается торговлей овощами. В основном Наби продает бахчевые культуры (лук, картофель и морковь). Он уже год в этом бизнесе. Наби запрашивает кредит для закупа картошки с целью перепродажи.
texts.en: Nabi is 31, and lives with his family in Rudaki, in central Tadjikistan. Nabi is a very determined and hardworking person. He sells produce, mainly melons (also onions, potatoes, and carrots). He has been in this business for a year. Nabi is requesting a loan to buy potatoes for later resale.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for later resale.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es: Feliz Alberto 51 años de edad casado con ocho hijos menores de edad, todos estudian  él es originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega que se encuentra al oeste del occidente de Nicaragua, es una zona costera donde le negocio que más predomina  la pesca ya que está ubicado en una de las  playas que existe en Nicaragua, su negocio consiste en la  pesca, el cual lo realiza con sus propios equipos oficio que sus hijos han aprendido y trabajan negocio que tiene ya varios años de experiencia, el inicia desde muy temprana edad ya que no pudo construir una carrera universitaria debido a su recursos económicos ya que el venia de una familia muy pobre, y el con su trabajo fue ahorrando hasta poder comprar parte de su equipo de trabajo para la pesca. Ahora Félix está solicitando financiamiento para comprar equipos de trabajo y de esa manera renovar los que él tiene, uno de sus sueños es poder comprar otra lancha y así obtener mayor ingresos, él está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kivas por la ayuda que ellos brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Félix Alberto, 51, is married and has eight minor children who all attend school.  He's from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in western Nicaragua, a coastal area where the predominant business is fishing because it's located on one of the beaches of Nicararagua.

His business is fishing, which he does with his own equipment.  His children have learned the trade and they work.  He has had the business for several years.  He started at a very young age because he couldn't study for a university degree because he came from a very poor family and didn't have the economic resources.  With his job he saved money until he was able to buy part of his fishing equipment.

Currently Félix is requesting financing to buy work equipment so he can upgrade the equipment he has.

One of his dreams is to be able to buy another boat so he can earn more income.  He's very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer low-income people.

loans.use: to buy work equipment

loans.name: Kalita

texts.en:
Kalita is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. 

She runs a small business selling fish, octopus and sea cucumbers in her community and has been doing this for more than three years.

Kalita has requested a loan to buy a fishing boat, spears and fishing net. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

Kalita will use her earnings not only to improve her business, but also to support her family and her children's future education.

loans.use: to pay for a fishing boat, spears, fishing net, fishing gear, etc.

loans.name: Nakatudde Server*s Group

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old man and a resident of Wandegeya.  He is married with two children of whom neither is a student. He is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE Micro-finance and applied for 500,000 UGX in order to grow  his charcoal business. However, he has other businesses where he gets more income and that is from rent and his motorcycle that he uses to transport people.  He is a hardworking man and he looks forward to seeing his family succeed .He  wishes to  build a nice home for his family.

John  hopes  to borrow more money from UGAFODE in order to buy a plot of land and build a home for his mother. His major challenge is the weather which affects him so much .During rainy seasons the roads are very slippery and vehicles take a long time to deliver the charcoal to the town for sale. It is also a  time when prices are   very competitive. He  looks forward to getting another a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance if all goes according to plan.

The loan officer is in the photograph with the clients.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for his business

loans.name: Subhiya

texts.en:
Subhiya is 47 years old; she preferred to have a photo taken of her with her daughter. Bayan is a 19 years old and a single lady. She is a second-year student at the university studying about child care. 

Subhiya works in a school and her husband sells sheep to support their three daughters and a son. Now Subhiya wants to support her daughter Bayan in her studies so she applied for an educational loan to pay her daughter's next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma has been involved in agriculture for more than nine years. She lives in the Areni village of Vayots Dzor region with her husband and 17-year-old son. Jemma owns agricultural land where she grows 30 peach, three nut, two apple and five pear trees with great love and care. Jemma works hard to gather a good harvest, and her husband takes the gathered products to the market to sell.

Concerned with the critical state of the Armenian economy, Jemma does her best to perpetuate the profit which will help her to build a well-provided life for her family. To expand her current agricultural business, Jemma has applied to SEF International to purchase a calf and to cover fuel costs, which is very important for taking the gathered harvest to the market.

This loan is important for Jemma to enlarge her agricultural business and be able to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and cover fuel costs for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

loans.name: Falastine

texts.en: Falastine is a 39-year-old mother of five girls and one boy. Her husband works in changing cars’ tires. On the other hand, Falastine sells clothes and a few makeup products. She is applying for a loan today to increase the quantity she has by bringing in more summer clothing items and cosmetics for summer use.

loans.use: to bring in more summer clothing items.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 41-year-old conservative woman; her husband took her place in the photo.

Rana is a mother of two boys and two girls. She is helping her husband in bringing another income source to the family by selling home products at home. Her husband also started selling mobile-phone-credit cards to bring a supportive income. Now she is applying for a loan to support her husband and bring in more phone-credit cards from another cellphone company.

loans.use: To bring in more phone-credit cards.

loans.name: Maria Estenia

texts.es: María Estenia 37 años casada con un hijo, originaria del municipio de Chinandega el cual está ubicado al occidente del país, maría estenia es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir para obtener los su alimento diario, con muchos esfuerzos y trabajos ella logro terminar la secundaria pero lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho disfrutar con su hijo en escuchar música y hacerle relatos de cuando ella era pequeña de como era antes, gracias a su espíritu y ganas de prosperar ella instala un salón de belleza en su casa de domicilio donde brinda el servicio de: corte de pelo, tintes, manicure, pedicure, masajes, uñas acrílicas, peinados, también vende productos de la omnilife, cosméticos entre otros, ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales,  uno de sus sueños es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella está solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos para su salón de belleza y cosméticos como: tintes, uñas acrílicas, alisados, maquillajes, entre otros productos más y así ofrecerles mejores productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Estenia is a 37-year old married woman and mother of a son. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, located on the west side of the country, and is a hard-working and responsible woman that has fought to get ahead since she was very young. With big effort and hard work, she was able to finish her secondary education, although unfortunately she could not attend university. She enjoys her free time with her son listening to music and telling him stories from her childhood. 

Motivated by her enthusiasm and her wish of self-improvement, she started a beauty salon in her house, where she offers several services: haircuts, dyes, manicure, pedicure, massages, acrylic nails and hairstyle. She also sells Omnilife products (cosmetics and others) and has both regular and occasional clients. 

One of her dreams is to improve her business conditions and to offer a better service. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy products for her salon and cosmetics such as dyes, acrylic nails, hair straightening lotions and make-up, among others. Thanks to this loan she'll be able to offer better products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as acrylic nails, various dyes, hair straightening lotions and make-up, among others.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a dress store for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophea applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy more dresses for resale. By doing so, she would generate more profits to support the family financially. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy more dresses to sell in her store.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is involved in agriculture. She lives with her husband (in the photo), son, daughter-in-law and two young grandchildren. 

Together with her husband, Seda keeps three cows and two calves and she also grows peach and plum trees. They have already started the cultivation work for spring. 

To ensure that she and her husband are able to undertake all the necessary tasks, Seda has applied to SEF International for a loan. She needs this loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to transport her agricultural products to the market. The loan will also help Seda to purchase five oxen, enabling her to increase her livestock. 

Seda hopes that the loan will help her to increase her agricultural income so she will be able to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fuel to transport her agricultural products to the market as well as purchase five oxen.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 each day. Due to lack of funds, Tho is applying a loan of $1,000 to buy timber to build a new house. This loan will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her youngest child achieve higher education.

loans.use: to buy timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Qajik

texts.en:
Qajik has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. He cultivates tomatoes and grows 280 peach and 90 apricot trees. Sales of agricultural products give Qajik an income that is hardly enough for covering the family's costs.

Qajik's family consists of his wife, his 27-year-old son and his 10-year-old daughter. As agriculture helps Qajik to have stable income during the month and sustain his family, he would like to enlarge his agricultural business. 

He has requested a loan from SEF International to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

As the spring has already come, it is very important for Qajik to start the cultivation process in order to get a good harvest and high income.

Qajik hopes that the loan will help him to get higher income, and he will be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo José 26 años de edad casado con un hijo de 9 años de edad estudiante de primaria, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del occidente del país, zona donde el negocio más fuerte es la compra venta de ganado, agricultura, minería, cafetaleros entre otros más,  Inicialmente me dedicaba a la actividad económica de albañilería pero pasaba por problemas económicos ya que no contaba con trabajo fijo, entonces con la ayuda de mi padre quien se dedica a la actividad de ganadería inicia su propio negocio de comercio de ganado y actualmente tiene  5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que es la compra y venta de ganado en pie en este municipio y en comarcas aledañas, de manera ambulante compra al contado y vende al contado y al crédito uno de sus sueños es incrementar su capital de trabajo y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo que él logre culminar una carrera universitaria y ser un profesional en la vida, el con los creditos anteriores ha mejorado un poco su nivel de vida con los cuales con las utilidades ha ido comprando articulos para su hogar actualmente el comercializa 9 animales al mes. Ricardo está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de ganado para su venta, el está muy agradecidos con los inversionista Kivas por la oportunidad que ellos les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos y así poder tener un trabajo digno
texts.en:
Ricardo José, 26, is married with one 9-year-old child who is in elementary school.  He's from a town in Chinandega, located in the north of the country, a region whose strongest industries are, among others, cattle sales, agriculture, mining, and coffee growing.  At first he earned his living as a bricklayer, but due to economic problems, he no longer had steady work.  So with help from his father, who raised cattle, he started his own cattle business and has been in business for 5 years now buying and selling heads of cattle in his own and neighboring towns.  He travels around buying in cash and selling in cash and for credit.  

One of Ricardo José's dreams is to increase his working capital so his son can have a better future, finish college, and have a profession.  With his prior loans Ricardo José improved his quality of life a bit.  He has been using his profits to buy some things for his home.  He currently sells 9 cattle per month.

Ricardo José is seeking a loan to buy cattle to sell.  He is really appreciative of the Kiva lenders for the support they give people of limited means, so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy head of cattle to sell.
